result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew L. Huettl

defendant.name: Huettl, Matthew L.
defendant.address: 301 Washington St, c/o Oconto County Jail, Oconto, WI 54153

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on January 30, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Warrant Paperwork Returned from the Sheriffs Dept.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew L. Huettl
Current: 301 Washington St, c/o Oconto County Jail, Oconto, WI 54153 United States  (Effective: 07-15-2022)
Prior: 17239 Maple Acres Ln, Townsend, WI 54175

1:34 PM Defendant Matthew L. Huettl appeared by video, in custody Oconto County Jail.   Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner Taylor O Soule in court for Matthew L. Huettl. 

ADA Dodge calls the case and states the appearances.
ADA Dodge would ask that the warrant be quashed.
ADA Dodge would ask that the $1,000 signature bond be reinstated.
Atty Bergner has no objections.

BY THE COURT: 
Warrant is quashed.
Bond is reinstated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:30 PM Defendant Matthew L. Huettl not in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Matthew L. Huettl. 

Defendant fails to appear.
Court questions Atty Soule.
She has not information to provide to the Court.

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.
ADA Mutchler would request a warrant with a cash alternative 

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $1,000 cash alternative

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for August 1, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 3
Defendant REFUSED to Sign the Signature Bond

**SIGNATURE BOND REINSTATED ON AUGUST 12, 2022**
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

1:90 PM Defendant Matthew Lee Huettl appeared by video in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner is present in court.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping and Possession of Methamphetamine. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for a public defender.
State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
